SEARCH
Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram

Class InterfaceEditorManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram.InterfaceEditorManager
public class InterfaceEditorManager extends Object

Interface Editor Manager

The InterfaceEditorManager class is responsible for managing the data and logic behind the Interface Editor UI. It handles the retrieval and update of the interface's name and methods, as well as managing the temporary parameters while defining methods.

It interacts with the UI components to modify and apply changes to the interface model, including adding methods, parameters, and custom data types.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-04

  • Field Details

    • parameters

      public List<String> parameters
      A list of parameters for the current method being defined.

      This list temporarily stores the parameters for the method as the user adds them. After the method is finalized, the list is cleared.

  • Constructor Details

    • InterfaceEditorManager

      public InterfaceEditorManager()
      Default constructor.

      Initializes the InterfaceEditorManager. No specific initialization is required for this class, but this constructor ensures proper object creation.

  • Method Details

    • setClassDiagramManager

      public void setClassDiagramManager(ClassDiagramManager manager)
      Sets the reference to the ClassDiagramManager instance.

      This method allows the InterfaceEditorManager to interact with the ClassDiagramManager, enabling updates to the UML model and class diagram.

      Parameters:
      manager - The ClassDiagramManager instance to be set.

    • setInterfaceBox

      public void setInterfaceBox(javafx.scene.layout.VBox interfaceBox, UMLInterfaceBox umlInterfaceBox)
      Sets the VBox representing the interface.

      This method sets the reference to the VBox that represents the interface. It is used to retrieve the interface's name and methods, as well as update them when changes are applied.

      Parameters:
      interfaceBox - The VBox containing the interface's name and methods.

    • getInterfaceName

      public String getInterfaceName()
      Retrieves the name of the interface.

      This method extracts the name of the interface from the interfaceBox by looking at the second child, which is assumed to be a Label containing the interface name.

      Returns:
      The name of the interface, or an empty string if the name is not set.

    • getMethods

      public String getMethods()
      Retrieves the methods of the interface as a string.

      This method extracts all method names from the interfaceBox by iterating through its children. The methods are assumed to be stored in a VBox located as the third child of the interfaceBox. The method names are returned as a concatenated string, with each method on a new line.

      Returns:
      A string containing all methods of the interface, separated by new lines.

    • applyChanges

      public void applyChanges(String interfaceName, String methodsText)
      Applies changes to the interface.

      This method updates the interface's name and methods in the interfaceBox. It clears the existing methods and adds the new methods as Label nodes styled in italic.

      Parameters:
      interfaceName - The new name of the interface.
      methodsText - The new method signatures as a string.

    • handleCustomDataType

      public static void handleCustomDataType(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> dropdown)
      Handles adding a custom data type to a ComboBox.

      This method opens a dialog that prompts the user to input a custom data type. If the user provides a valid custom data type, it is added to the ComboBox and selected as the current value.

      Parameters:
      dropdown - The ComboBox to which the custom data type should be added.

    • addParameterToMethod

      public void addParameterToMethod(String parameter)
      Adds a parameter to the temporary list of parameters.

      This method adds a parameter to the list of parameters for the current method being defined. It is used when the user specifies method parameters.

      Parameters:
      parameter - The parameter to add to the current method.

    • finalizeMethod

      public String finalizeMethod(String methodName, String returnType, String visibility)
      Finalizes the method signature with the parameters.

      This method constructs the full method signature by combining the method name, return type, visibility, and parameters. The parameters are formatted as "name: type" and inserted into the signature.

      Parameters:
      methodName - The name of the method.
      returnType - The return type of the method.
      visibility - The visibility of the method (e.g., public, private).
      Returns:
      The final method signature as a string.

    • resetParameters

      public void resetParameters()
      Resets the list of parameters after a method is finalized.

      This method clears the temporary list of parameters to prepare for the next method definition.
